messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I don't WANT a new baby!
messages.msgSnippet: THIS is adorable. :)  My sister s best friend was very pregnant with her second and my niece was told often that she had a baby in her tummy. She stopped
messages.messageBody:
THIS is adorable. :) <BG>

My sister's best friend was very pregnant with her
second and my niece was told often that she had a baby
in her tummy. She stopped talking to her. Didn't say
anything mean, just started ignoring her mom's friend.
Then one day she very quietly and looking very
betrayed and sad said she didn't like her anymore.
when my sis asked her why she said "Cuz she ATE her
baby, mom!"
kids. gotta love 'em.
-Bobbie

messages.subject: I don't WANT a new baby!
messages.msgSnippet: I don t want a new baby. This was my oldest son Brian s response when I told him his father and I were expecting a third child.  We d survived the first
messages.messageBody:
"I don't want a new baby."
This was my oldest son Brian's response when I told him his father
and I were expecting a third child. We'd survived the first round of
sibling rivalry when his brother, Damian was born. But now, three-
year-old Brian had made his stand about this new baby, and neither
logic, reason, noe persuasion could budge him.
Puzzled, I asked him, "Why don't you want a new baby?" With wide and
teary eyes, he looked straight at me and said, "Because I want to
keep Damian." by Rosemary Laurey

Kandy
